Suppose we need to compare the toxicity induced by substance A and substance B, then we use a standardised Microtox test to quantify the observed effects of these substances on the bioluminescence of a marine bacterium. 

Following the laboratory tests, consider this data set:

<img src="images/article_tables_example.png"
     alt="raw_data"
     style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"/>

After obtain these data, you can use the following function of the microtoxR package:

> pak::pkg_install("bbellier/microtoxR_package")

> library(microtoxR)

> run.microtoxR()

A window opens and you can read a description of how the Microtox test and the package work as follows:

<img src="images/presentation_tab.png"
     alt="presentation"
     style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"/>
     
Then you can see that the data are filled in the boxes for the "Scheme", "Time 5", "Time 15" and "Time 30" tabs:

<img src="images/scheme_tab.png"
     alt="scheme"
     style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"/>
     
<img src="images/t5_tab.png"
     alt="t5"
     style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"/>
     
<img src="images/t15_tab.png"
     alt="t15"
     style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"/>
     
<img src="images/t30_tab.png"
     alt="t30"
     style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"/>
     
The package after arrange and calculate all the need metrics. 

1/ You can see the final data table in the Table tab:

<img src="images/table_tab.png"
     alt="table"
     style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"/>
     
2/ You can construct a simple plot in the first part of the Plot tab:

<img src="images/plot_tab1.png"
     alt="plot1"
     style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"/>
     
3/ You can view the EC50/CE20 values and a plot in the second part of the Plot tab:

<img src="images/plot_tab2.png"
     alt="plot2"
     style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"/>
     
At the end to quit the application, you can use the Exit tab:

<img src="images/exit_tab.png"
     alt="exit"
     style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"/>
